title: ms bug?
body:
When I have jax with blue boots and triforce i have 424 ms, when i buy the ms boots enchant (+20ms) I should get 444ms, but I only get 442ms.
Same with ninja tabi, doesnt matter which way round I build it.
Triforce is plus 8 percent ms, is this taken on current ms, or champions natural ms ?
Because if its natural ms then .08 * 350 = 28,

In this order:
Jax ms, 350 + blue boots + enchant = 415
Jax ms, 350 + 45 + 20 = 415 (this value is solid)
Buy tri force (8percent on natural ms) is + 28ms, so 415 + 28ms = 443

But I only get 442 ms, what am I not understanding here!!!

how does triforce ms 8percent work?!?!?

replies.body:
Firstly, you must understand that there are two types of bonuses you can apply to your champion statistics, in addition to their base stats. Base stats are unchangeable with items, and only go up as you level up. Then, you have normal, stacking speed. For an items like Boots, which gives you +20 move-speed, you should see a normal increase of move-speed by 20 units. There would not be a situation where buying an item with flat move-speed would give you anything *less* than what is labelled. Then there is bonus % move-speed, from items such as Trinity Force or abilities that grant move-speed temporarily. Percentages, when stacked, will add to themselves additively. Eg. if you get an 8% move-speed item and then cast an ability on yourself which gives you a bonus 6% move-speed, you'll have a total of 14% move-speed bonus applied to your stat. It's not 8% is applied first, and then 6% multiplied on top of that.

WHICH eventually brings us to our case. When you have an already existing 8% move-speed item and buy a flat move-speed item, then you'll get the 8% bonus applied to that item as well, increasing +20 move-speed to +21 move-speed.

So, yes, this is a bug.
